questions.question: What is the advantage of using a Class to represent a Book rather than just a dictionary?

options.text: It can store methods (behavior) alongside the data
It is required for saving to files
It is easier to manage as the system grows
Classes use less memory than dictionaries

questions.explanation: Classes provide a structured template that encapsulates both the attributes and the actions (methods) associated with an entity.

questions.question: Why use ISBN as the dictionary key in the Library class?

options.text: It allows for instant lookup without looping through all books

questions.explanation: Using a unique identifier as a key allows for highly efficient retrieval of data.

questions.question: What does the '__str__' method do?

options.text: Defines what happens when you print() the object

questions.explanation: __str__ is a 'magic method' that provides a human-readable string representation of an object.

questions.question: Arrange the logic for 'Borrowing' a book:

items.text: Add current time to history list
